name: Standard Clauses
description: Standard legal and commercial clauses for professional services

content.text: All invoices issued by
to
are payable within thirty (30) days of the invoice date. Late payments shall incur interest at a rate of 2% per month on the outstanding balance.
Payment shall be made by electronic funds transfer to the bank account details provided on the invoice, unless otherwise agreed in writing.
shall charge
for professional services rendered at the rates agreed upon in the engagement schedule. Fees are exclusive of Value Added Tax (VAT), which shall be charged at the prevailing rate where applicable.
Any disbursements or third-party costs incurred on behalf of the client will be invoiced at cost, plus a reasonable administration fee where applicable.
By signing this document,
acknowledges and accepts the terms and conditions set out herein for the engagement with

This engagement shall commence on the date of signature and continue until completion of the agreed scope of work, unless terminated earlier in accordance with the termination provisions of this agreement.

clauses.title: Client Responsibilities
clauses.description: Obligations and duties of the client

content.text: shall provide

The client acknowledges that delays in providing requested information may impact service delivery timelines and that

The total aggregate liability of
to
in respect of all claims arising out of or in connection with this engagement shall not exceed the total fees paid by the client for the specific engagement giving rise to the claim.
Neither party shall be liable to the other for any indirect, consequential, or special damages, including but not limited to loss of profit, loss of data, or loss of business opportunity.
maintains professional indemnity insurance in an amount appropriate to the nature and scale of services provided. Details of coverage are available upon written request from
This insurance covers claims arising from professional negligence, errors, or omissions in the provision of services under this engagement.
Both
and
agree to maintain the confidentiality of all proprietary and sensitive information disclosed during the course of this engagement.

Confidential information shall not be disclosed to any third party without the prior written consent of the disclosing party, except where required by law, regulation, or professional obligation. This obligation shall survive the termination of this engagement.
Either party may terminate this engagement by providing thirty (30) days written notice to the other party.
shall be entitled to payment for all services rendered and expenses incurred up to the effective date of termination.
Upon termination,
shall deliver all completed work product to
and return any client-owned documents and materials within a reasonable period.
Neither
nor
shall be liable for any failure or delay in performing their obligations under this engagement where such failure or delay results from circumstances beyond the reasonable control of that party.
Such circumstances include, but are not limited to, natural disasters, acts of government, pandemic, civil unrest, power failures, or failures of telecommunications infrastructure.
In the event of any dispute arising out of or in connection with this engagement,
and
agree to first attempt resolution through good-faith negotiation between senior representatives of each party.
If the dispute cannot be resolved through negotiation within thirty (30) days, either party may refer the matter to mediation. The costs of mediation shall be shared equally between the parties.
